disclaimerData.disclaimer:
PATIENT AGREEMENT: This form provides information about the advantages and risks of multi-colour laser tattoo removal. Read thoroughly and discuss with your practitioner before proceeding.

Take time to consider options, seek second opinions, and ask questions. Multi-colour tattoo removal uses lasers with multiple wavelengths (e.g., 1064 nm for black, 532 nm for red, 755 nm for green) to target different ink colors, breaking particles into fragments cleared by the immune system. Sessions last 10-30 minutes per area, with numbing cream applied first; multiple sessions (6-12+) spaced 6-8 weeks apart are needed, as results vary by ink depth, color, skin type, and tattoo age.

Improvements appear gradually over months; complete removal isn't guaranteed, especially for multicolored or deep inks, and tattoos may fade unevenly. You'll be informed of practitioner and location per session, can withdraw consent anytime, and must avoid sun exposure 4 weeks before/after using high-SPF sunscreen.

RISKS AND POSSIBLE REACTIONS: Common effects include pain (like rubber band snaps), redness, swelling, blistering, pinpoint bleeding, crusting resolving in 1-2 weeks. Less common: infection, allergic reactions to ink, hyperpigmentation/hypopigmentation (higher risk in darker skin types 4-6), textural changes. Rare: scarring, color shifts in remaining ink.

Contraindications include recent sun tanning, Roaccutane use (within 6 months), photosensitizing meds, active skin infections, cancer history at site, iron/titanium inks.

I confirm understanding of procedure reasons, risks (including not treating), personal health risks, benefits, alternatives (e.g., covering tattoo), uncertainties, and follow-up.

MEDICAL IMAGERY: I authorize clinical photos/videos for records.

I certify reading and understanding this form, questions answered, and consent to procedure.

questions.content: Do you comprehend the details that have been given to you?
Do you believe enough information has been shared to allow you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent voluntarily?
Are there any health issues you currently have?
Are you currently pregnant or nursing a child?
Do you suffer from a neuromuscular disorder (such as Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune condition?
Do you experience any skin problems?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection at the area where the procedure is planned?
Are you currently on any antibiotics or other prescribed medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in detail.
What are your goals and desired results for undergoing this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you undergone this or a comparable treatment previously? If so, were there any issues? Please provide details.
Do you have any concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there anything else we need to know? Please provide full information.
I will keep this information for the duration of my treatment and consult it as needed.
